summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons inmate disciplinary record for Jeffrey Epstein, showing an incident report from July 23, 2019, for tattooing or self-mutilation that was later expunged due to insufficient evidence. The document indicates the disciplinary hearing occurred on August 1, 2019.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffrey Edward
persons.context: The inmate who is the subject of this disciplinary record, with an incident report for tattooing or self-mutilation that was later expunged.

persons.name: K. Hampton
persons.context: The Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) chairperson listed for the hearing regarding Epstein's incident report.

connections.description: Hampton served as the Disciplinary Hearing Officer chairperson for Epstein's hearing regarding the incident report.

events.title: Tattooing/Self-Mutilation Incident
events.description: An incident report (3282555) was filed against Jeffrey Epstein for tattooing or self-mutilation while in custody.

events.title: DHO Hearing
events.description: A Disciplinary Hearing Officer hearing was held regarding the incident report against Epstein, chaired by K. Hampton.

events.title: Report Expunged
events.description: The incident report (3282555) was expunged due to insufficient evidence to support the prohibited act of tattooing or self-mutilation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein had an incident report (3282555) filed against him on July 23, 2019, for tattooing or self-mutilation while in custody.
The incident report was later expunged due to insufficient evidence to support the prohibited act.
A Disciplinary Hearing Officer hearing was held on August 1, 2019, regarding this incident, chaired by K. Hampton.
This document shows official Bureau of Prisons disciplinary procedures were followed regarding Epstein while he was incarcerated.
